doc.wiki: ASCII (/ˈæskiː/ (listen) ASS-kee),[2]:6 abbreviated from American Standard Code for Information Interchange, is a character encoding standard for electronic communication. ASCII codes represent text in computers, telecommunications equipment, and other devices. Most modern character-encoding schemes are based on ASCII, although they support many additional characters. The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) prefers the name US-ASCII for this character encoding.[3] ASCII is one of the IEEE milestones.
